heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 26 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (218°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.9°C) and outside temperature (up 2.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 117 m) and pressure (up 6 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 176 m) and inside temperature (up 2.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 116.8m higher than yesterday, 96.1m higher than the past week, 176.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 604m minimum and 2320m maximum, with an average of 1168.6m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1072.5m and 1344.9m.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry and less humid conditions and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dark. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
